alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Shoshone and southeastern Kootenai Counties through 330 PM PDT... At 257 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fourth Of July Pass, or 8 miles northwest of Pinehurst, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fourth Of July Pass, Rose Lake, Beauty Creek Campground, and Wolf Creek Campground. This includes Interstate 90 in Idaho near mile marker 18 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area
